alert.note: Alert for Curry; Quay; Roosevelt (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 28 at 7:30PM MDT until August 28 at 8:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Roosevelt County in east central New Mexico... Southeastern Quay County in east central New Mexico... Central Curry County in east central New Mexico... * Until 830 PM MDT. * At 730 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles west of Wheatland, or 22 miles southeast of Tucumcari, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Clovis, Quay, Melrose, Grady, Ragland, Ranchvale, Wheatland, Forrest and Mcalister. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 350 and 354. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Wind damage with this storm will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY! Blowing dust associated with strong thunderstorm winds can reduce visibilities below one quarter mile at times.
